website_summaries.verdict: Both affordable and versatile, and about half the price of other FURminator models. The brand's most effective and affordable all-purpose grooming tool.
pros: Has FURflex head for comfortably grooming around contours
Pins are rounded for comfort and rotate to prevent tugging
Ideal for dogs, cats, other animals, and long coats
Keeps fur from "flying away" during grooming
cons: Requires a gentle touch for small, sensitive animals
Has the tendency to pull tangled fur

website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for dog owners for keeping long fur smooth and mat-free by a brand that understands the essentials of grooming.
pros: Versatile rake by a popular brand
Unique design helps catch fur while grooming for quick clean up
Rounded, rotating pins help it maneuver through most coat types
cons: Caution required as pins can be irritating on sensitive skin
Some reports of the top breaking off the handle

customer_reviews.title: Buy one for your husky!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this thing seven stars, but five will have to do. I was able to pull entire sheets of undercoat out of our husky without disturbing the topcoat. I've never had anything work so well. It's even easier to keep the fur pile together. The fur stays clumped, instead of getting spread out and floating around like with the blade style furminator. This thing really digs the loose stuff out so much faster and easier. Check the photo to see what 20 minutes will get you.
customer_reviews.author: pvfjr

customer_reviews.title: Love this brush
customer_reviews.text: Best brush ever! Gets so much hair out of my dog!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Spore

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Performs as expected. Used for a Great Pyrenees. Look at all the fur! This is a rake/comb, not the razor type Furminator...
customer_reviews.author: mama_again@38

customer_reviews.title: Great brush. I use for my Siberian husky and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great brush. I use for my Siberian husky and it does great with removing her undercoat. My girl does not mind being brushed however she sometimes gets "aggravated" after a long brushing session. She loves this brush and will allow me to comb through her hair for as long as I like with this brush. I would recommend for sure! Cannot wait to try other brushes from the furminator collection!
customer_reviews.author: LilzTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Removes loose undercoat AND stickers!  RAWR!
customer_reviews.text: My golden and sticker burrs have an ongoing relationship. I do not approve of it. This helps to break them apart when needed. Removes loose undercoat and these dang stickers with ease! Love it! I use it every morning on her and she loves it as well. Super easy and seems to be more gentle that the regular furminator. My favorite thing is the easy removal of the sticker burrs. Of course, you have to catch them before they get tangled in the fur. Then scissors seem to be the only way out of that situation. As you can see in the picture, she is quite furry! =)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: FUR BABIES MUST HAVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: After one use on my Great Pyreneese, I think I had enough hair to make another one. Wow, had no idea he had THAT much undercoat! He stayed calm (not in his nature) while combimg, so I know he likes it too.
customer_reviews.author: texaschristina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: If I had to pick one brush for my dog (Great Pyrenees) this is definitely the brush. It does great just brushing him to keep his hair from matting, or brushing out dirt and junk that gets caught in his hair. He seems to like it and it does not pull on his hair. Even brushes his hair on his legs without hurting his legs. He sleeps through brushing, which is not always the case with some brushes we've tried before. Great quality brush and has held up for over a year of regular use. If something ever happens to this brush, I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: so that amazing low price is for a reason
customer_reviews.text: FAKE Knock-off the breaks! BEWARE! This cannot possibly be a "real" Furminator. It broke literally the first time I used it. Handle came loose, then completly pulled off the stem. Cannot use it without a handle of course. And the teeth did not feel as if they rotated as claimed, just was not the real thing despite authentic looking packaging. I guess you get what you pay for, so that amazing low price is for a reason. Unfortunately I learned the hard way, after throwing the package away, so no refun possible. An actual Furminator shold last you for years. This one broke after maybe 100 strokes.Well that was a waste. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started out great. But after week and a half handle keeps falling off.
customer_reviews.text: Have to change my rating after using the rake for a week and a half on my long haired Golden the handle keeps slipping off. I originally rated this as five stars. But after using it a few times on my dog the handle keeps falling off. Looks like others have experienced the same thing. Maybe a batch off bad ones made. If it we not for the handle coming off this is a great product. Will be returning and will try to order one more time to see if I get one that does not have handle fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Sports Fan

customer_reviews.title: Works great til the handle falls off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had an earlier model for about two years and it broke recently. It was my favorite grooming tool for my thick coated Samoyed. I got this thinking it would be the same. It works great until the handle falls off. The first one I bought lasted about 2 brushings until the handle fell off. I asked amazon to return it and they sent me a new one. Same thing happened. 5 brushings in and the handle grip just slides off. I can put it back on but it falls off again with any resistance from the hair.
customer_reviews.author: Matt LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Good *second* step in grooming long-haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have a herd of Pekingese that require some regular maintenance. They have double coats, and long hair (we don't clip them short) so they need a solid investment of time every week to get the hair brushed out. During the spring blowout, this hair rake is fabulous as a second step - using it from the start pulls too much and the dogs protest quite a bit. After using the wire pin brush to get the layers straightened, the Furminator is good for working all that loose coat out. If you have long-haired pups like we do, this is handy as a tool in the arsenal against the floofpocalypse, but not a one-hit wonder on its own.
customer_reviews.author: B. Booth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have the regular FURminator and it works great on a regular dog with shorter hair/fur however not so much with a very large Husky. Thor is a (big giant fur beast) husky that is shedding so much so that one would think there is a hairless dog running around. His shedding is miserable for everyone in the house. So when I saw this FURminator and that it has longer teeth I thought this might just work. That was a huge understatement as it works amazingly. If you have a pooch that has longer hair/fur then you NEED this Furminator straight away. It will save you a little bit of sanity during shedding season.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Worthless for my shedding Lab, I’m returning it.
customer_reviews.text: It does not remove hair (very little) from my shedding Labrador. I can get just as much off by wiping with my hand. This worked much better till it broke, I wanted to try something else, going back to this:
customer_reviews.author: Rozycke

customer_reviews.title: Better than the standard FURminator!
customer_reviews.text: I have a long haired dog, She's an Idaho shag with a coli like coat and a curly undercoat. I first purchased the original FURminator but it tugged mostly and she hated it. This rake works great! Easily removes shedding hair but floats through her coat while it works. I use a de-tangle spray from time to time to help with the pulling, but she's a ranch dog and tends to get pretty dirty. So this is our pre-bath ritual.
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Best comb for huskies
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Husky you know how much they shed... I have tried every comb in the market for those months and only similar to this one work. This so far is the best, it pulls most of their fur and they actually liked it. Normally they would cry and complain but not with this one. Really liked it. Some users have complained about the handle falling off, so I put some superglue beforehand... just in case, but it has work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: This is a seriously awesome grooming tool.
customer_reviews.text: Springtime shedding has begun, and I have spent hours over the past several weeks trying to get all the loose hair brushed out of our German shepherd's coat a little at a time, as she would tolerate. I bought this comb on the recommendation of a great Pyrenees website, because we have two GP pups, and tried it out today on the German shepherd. WOW. In 10 minutes I was able to groom her entire coat and remove more loose fur than in all my previous sessions combined. And she (mostly) LIKED it! So glad to have found it!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth E. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this brush. I have an old cat that doesn’t groom his arthritic self very well any more. I had been using another highly rated brush, but it was not cutting it. It wasn’t really touching his undercoat at all. Enter this brush. It removed more fur in one brushing than I had gotten in WEEKS using the other brush. It was like magic. And it was very gentle on his mats as well. If you want to get a new handle on handsome for your old cats, I would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: abitbookish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for sensitive skinned pup
customer_reviews.text: My medium-sized Husky/cattle mix hates to be "messed with" in any way, but this comb makes it possible for me to groom the endless "tufts" out of her coat with a minimum of fuss. It gets so much in every stroke, without scratching her skin or making her jump away from me. I've been removing about 6 large handfuls of fur just from the ruff around her neck almost every day, and the difference is incredible. Just 5 minutes each afternoon, and she's even starting to enjoy it a little.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Maybe two flukes?
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning this as soon as I get back from vacation. I ordered one and then I ordered a replacement, thinking the first one was a fluke. Both times the rubber handle slid right off on the very first use. And I used them right after my dog came back from the groomer, so I could roll his coat. I'm disappointed, because I liked the fact that the teeth roll and that they are long for his long coat, but i simply can't brush without a handle and it feels silly to have to try to superglue something that I just bought.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpack meets tiger

customer_reviews.title: Removes tough mats from the undercoat!
customer_reviews.text: My poor Aussie and I have been fighting with mats in his undercoat with a regular dog brush with little success. He looked like no one loved him. I was skeptical but this removed all the stubborn mats easily. It looks a little medieval but it doesn't seem to bother him. I filled a paper grocery bag with his fur and he looks so much better. I think he's pretty happy as well. I definitely recommend this for Aussies, Huskies, or any dog that has a dense coat.
customer_reviews.author: Kat M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today. I opened the mailing package and the box looked like it had been stepped on and then taped back up. When I opened the actual package with the item, the instructions were folded a completely different way than the way it is when you receive a new item so I'm thinking I received a used comb. Regardless, it's fantastic. It removed the fur that I needed it to. I have two different brushes that I purchased and this one is by far the best one!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Works great on our Bernese Mountain Dog.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on our Adult female Bernese Mountain Dog. Her tumble weeds are found throughout the house and she is our baby so they are all over us as well. This has done a great job reducing it. She doesnt mind it unlike others I have tried and it works well on light mats as well. For a long haired dog, a rake is a must and this helps keep their coats nice and soft, follow it up wit ha soft brush and the fluff is beautiful and soft.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Used on my fussy Pomeranian successfully
customer_reviews.text: First time ever I brushed my dog without a fight. He always hates getting his hair brushed, I snuck up on him like I was going to pet him and started with his head. He let me brush for 10 minutes before he moved. He never lets me brush his hair with other devices. It delivered a nice pile of hair too and he looks great.
customer_reviews.author: rhae

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my Malamute and Husky
customer_reviews.text: I have a pure alaskan malamute AND a pure husky. I think it is important to note because when I researched brushes, this was hardly mentioned so it was hard to judge how good it'd be. With that said, this works very well! I am able to brush out the loose undercoat from them both pretty easily and they look so much better and they obviously feel better and less itchy. It is going into spring, so they are shedding their undercoats like crazy. This brush helps keep my vacuum from being overused and overworked!
customer_reviews.author: Miles Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BRUSH
customer_reviews.text: This brush is wonderful. I haven't even sat down with my dog to do a full brushing set, just brushed him for about 10 minutes after pulling it out of the package. It got the knots that have been forming around his ears and his buttocks. For reference, he is a great pyrenees/golden mix. I have always heard about "the furminator" but never wanted to pay the price. This one finally went on sale for Prime Day and I'm so, so happy I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Gets gobs of hair from our shepard
customer_reviews.text: Our german shepard's favorite past time seems to be shedding all over our house. This brush has helped immensely with that issue. We get loads of hair in this brush. It should be noted that this brush does not do a great job of trapping hair so I would still recommend doing this outside or with a shop vac at the ready. Good price and good quality. We leave it outside where it gets lots of sun and it hasn't broken down on us yet or lost any tines. We actually started using this brush in tandem with a fine-tined brush for best results.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to remove super thick fur
customer_reviews.text: My rescue pup has a thick coat and during summer she is always shedding. I bought this tool for her. It is super fast to comb through her thick coat and easy to remove the fur. I have no idea what the 'stretch' rating is for. This is a solid rubber handle attached to the comb - there is no stretch. I would like it if the teeth of the comb were more secure. When I come through her fur, the teeth make a 'clicking, wobbling' sound. Otherwise, this is a great tool, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: FWH HulaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Works  great
customer_reviews.text: This got so much fur out on the first brushing that I thought I almost had another cat in the wastebasket. And Sox loved it. He rolled and rolled finally turning over so I could do his belly, too. He would have liked it if I could have kept the brushing up forever. I had to give it us when my arm tired after about half an hour. One happy cat and I hope one less furry house and hair balls.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: No haggling over getting a refund!!!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product if your dog has long hair or matted. I thought this would help remove undercoat because I have a rubber rake that I use on my carpet & it’s amazing the amount of hair it picks up, so I thought this would be good. I also have another furminator product. My dog's hair (English Lab) isn’t long enough for this to be effective. Attempted to return it & get a refund. My account was refunded with no problems at all. Will work with this company again!
customer_reviews.author: GY

customer_reviews.title: Function
customer_reviews.text: I bought the FURminator Grooming Rake on the recommendation from FURminator, because I have a long haired dog that the fur matts easily and for use in conjunction with the FURminator Deshed tool. I have 3 large long haired dogs and boy or boy can they shed a lot. Not only does it reduce the amount of shedding by a huge amount, it keeps my dogs fur from becoming matted. If you have long haired dogs (there is also one for cats) I highly recommend using both of these products, you will be amazed how well they work.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Fell apart in first week, first the logo sticker came off which is no big deal at all except that it was sticky and gummy where the sticker had been. Got that scrubbed off as best I could and then the next time I used it, the handle came loose from the head, my dog was not matted or tangled. I ordered a Chris Christensen one which I should have done in first place and not wasted $8.99 on the furminator one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Modrall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for German Shepherd
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepherd puppy hated being brushed with the previous two sided brush we had. So I got this rake, hoping it would help control shedding & that he wouldn't try to eat it the entire time I brushed him. Thankfully, this brush does exactly what I was hoping. It gets a ton of loose hair off his whole body which is awesome because he sheds A LOT. I think it must feel like he's getting a massage because he doesn't try to attack the brush anymore, and will lay right now when I start brushing him.
customer_reviews.author: ArentzFamily

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for undercoats!
customer_reviews.text: I have a German shepherd and a rough coated collie mix that have some serious undercoat sheds. Brushing is typically a nightmare. I am so happy with this rake! It does an AMAZING job of removing the stubborn undercoat and helps prevent all of those tufts of fur that make the dogs look unkempt and leave a mess in our house. Definitely recommend for double coated dogs!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Must have for long coats!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a long coat pooch you need this rake, in my opinion. The other Furminator with the blades is too damaging to be used on long coats. When my pup had her puppy fur I used a slicker then followed up with this rake. Now that her adult fur is in I'm using a pin brush along with this rake. If I had to have only one brush it would be this one hands down. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I just got one of these and wish I had done it sooner! I have 2 dogs that have medium length, thick coats. One is a lab mix and the other is a husky mix. Both shed quite a bit and I’ve struggled to find a good brush for them. I can’t believe how much hair this removed from them with just a quick brushing. Neither really like traditional brushes but did really good with this. Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaelin

customer_reviews.title: The last brush you will ever buy!
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply the best brush we've bought for our cats. It makes brushing our long-haired kitty easier but she still protests. Our males love it and that is a plus! The brush's needles rotate 365* and that's the trick. It pulls hair that our other garbage brushes didn't. Brush your cat or dog with your current brush as a test. Then brush with the FURminator and you'll see what I'm talking about.
customer_reviews.author: ToxicWaste

customer_reviews.title: A must have for a double coated dog.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Golden Retriever and if you didn't know they are double coated dogs so reaching his thick undercoat with regular brushes can be difficult. I paid this with a self cleaning slicker brush and it worked wonders during the summer shedding process. It's cheaper than a lot of other under coat rakes but it's a good heavy duty well made product.
customer_reviews.author: AJSmith

customer_reviews.title: Really clears out the dog's hair, gently.
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this has a rake head, it glides easily through my great pyrenees/golden retrevier's hair, and boy does he have hair. Really cleans it out nicely without tugging or pulling.
customer_reviews.author: JM in OH

customer_reviews.title: Best for fluffy dog
customer_reviews.text: Magic wand for dog hair! My big dog is a husky/ border collie mix and sheds huge tumbleweeds across my house. He tolerates me brushing him with this for small intervals, which is better than I can say for any brush we have ever tried. And it grabs onto any tangles and undercoat easily! I wish it were double the size so I could get more done while he lets me brush him! But this thing is magic. Get it if you have a big floofer doggo!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW....
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the box, I used this brush on my (almost) 10 month old Golden Retriever. It EASILY removed a huge ball of fluff. I am hopeful that this will keep her hair from glittering the wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: tntmccarn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my mid length haired dog buddy!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Furminator products for about a decade now, and swear by the brand for grooming products! This particular rake was perfect for getting at the long seasonal coat on my medium length haired german shepherd / collie mix. The metal teeth are balled on the ends, so they don't catch or pinch at the skin (tested on myself), and they also rotate, adding to the comfort of your dog pal and the collection of loose furs. All in all, really glad I got this grooming rake, would highly recommend for anyone who grooms their fur pal regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Cut shedding by more than half
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my boyfriends long haired dog- doesn’t do much for our short haired. The long haired dog used to shed like crazy and large tufts of hair would collect literally everywhere but with regular use of this brush we don’t have to clean up after him constantly. Need to use it regularly to keep tangles at bay because it is not a great detangling brush
customer_reviews.author: Gertl

customer_reviews.title: It Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this comb in an attempt to to get to the bottom of the fur of my son’s Bernese Mountain Dog. One day after receiving it my daughter-in-law called me singing its praises. She had a similar one with shorter teeth that didn’t work very well. This one got all the way through their Bernie’s thick fur and she was able to remove lots of it! She and I can’t recommend it enough!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Donathan

customer_reviews.title: Great for short haired cattledog
customer_reviews.text: Have an ACD mix -- shorter hair but this thing works great. I was surprised given the teeth are so far apart that it would even pull anything out. But this is exactly what i need especially in these warm weather days! I have the grey version and seems very sturdy so not sure about the complaints with the green version falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: So much hair!
customer_reviews.text: We have a German Shepherd and they shed like crazy! Especially in spring. This brush is amazing, I cannot believe how much hair comes out. I feel like I could brush all day and it would just keep coming! It did however come apart in the first couple uses, I was able to super glue it wasn’t a huge deal, but the only reason I didn’t give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on Himalayan Cat
customer_reviews.text: I have a 13lb Himalayan cat with a thick double coat. He loves grooming but the original furminator pulls a bit too much of the under coat out at once. This is gentler, goes all the way to the root of the hair (3-4” of hair depth mind you) and gets as much loose hair as the Original—but with a more even distribution of top and bottom coats. My cat likes it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: So far great but
customer_reviews.text: I think this works very well for dogs with medium to longer hair. My dog is 55 pounds and German ish in nature. I got all this hair out even after she was groomed. It's wide to cover a lot of area so you're not brushing forever. I've read reviews about the handle breaking. Seems sturdy to me. I'll update if that does happen.
customer_reviews.author: MCaceres

customer_reviews.title: Best. Brush. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these we bought so we can brush more than one dog at a time. We have 5 doodles, all with different coat types, and this brush is WONDERFUL for every single one. It collects so much hair and works through any mats. I would recommend this brush to anyone. The only negative is that the handle does fall off after a while, but it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Danica S.

customer_reviews.title: Best deshedding tool I have found
customer_reviews.text: I have a variety of dog brushes, including slicker brushes and the original furminator. For dogs with thick undercoats, this thing is fabulous. It holds all the removed fuzz in the brush, vs having to grab it each time like the furminator and removing the fur is also easier than any other deshedding tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Why did they stop making the rotating head model with 2 size teeth?
customer_reviews.text: I had a friend out to the house with a dog that had long fur and shed constantly. My dog brush is a discontinued Furminator model with a rotating head with fine and coarse teeth (bring it back darn it- the thing is awesome) and we tried it on his dog and he was amazed. As a result I bought him one because it made such a difference in his dogs coat. He loves it!! The 4 stars were because the old model is no longer available and now you wind up buying 2 brushes if you have 2 lengths of dog fur.
customer_reviews.author: CarKrazy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!! This is a life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Having multiple dogs is a pain to clean up after especially during the changing seasons - with this I was able to REALLY brush away all their excess fur with ease and they love it! SO easy to use, to empty, and to wash if needed. VERY happy with my purchase just wish I would have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Kuheler

customer_reviews.title: Great for my huskies!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great for getting all that undercoat fur out when my dogs are blowing their coat. This is a must because a slicker bush just won’t cut it and you’ll never get all of their fur out. Definitely recommend I’ve had this for a few years before I wrote this review. Trust me you won’t be sorry
customer_reviews.author: Justin Halstead

customer_reviews.title: Didn't really work for me
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this item as it did not do a good job with my husky-mutt's undercoat. It seems like it might be better for a dog with longer hair. My pup has really thick fur but it's not long; it didn't really pull much out of the base. Not a bad product but didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Fire_medic

customer_reviews.title: Super brush!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing brush! Zooms through hair, pulls lots of loose hair out on every pass and doesn't seem to pull. Works great on long Golden Retriever hair!
customer_reviews.author: Kim E.

customer_reviews.title: loves it!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: my long haired cat absolutely loves this product. all i have to do is sit down and pick up the comb and he comes running over. he lets me brush him as long as i am willing to. he rolls over so i can get his belly. other short haired cats not so much. our border collie loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Chow Chow retiever mix.
customer_reviews.text: I get so much hair out from my dogs undercoat I don't even know how she has any hair left. Bags and bags. (Grocery bag size) every week. It's transitioning into spring and summer so I'm trying to get her de-shedded before it gets too hot for her. This product is amazing. I bought the detangling spray to use with it, very important if your dog isn't used to being brushed or doesn't like their hair to be pulled.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: Best husky brush EVER
customer_reviews.text: I own Huskies. Best brush I've found. It effortlessly gets through their thick fur and instead of spreading it around the room as you brush it clings/holds onto it. It doesn't tug at the fur and quickly gets out the thick clumps. Dont mistake this for the original furminator which also incorporates a shedding blade... This is just a rake, and that is all you'll need!
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Wow. My huskies love it. Actually, don't have to hold them while combing.
customer_reviews.text: I had the classic furminator...which I now know removes the undercoat mostly. I added this to my routine for my huskies. It does pull out hair the other doesn't. It isn't as aggressive either, so the dogs seem to enjoy the brushings more. You need both brushes...You won't be sorry,
customer_reviews.author: Mark Peroutka

customer_reviews.title: A great way to get the soft hair off the dogs so the birds can line their nests.
customer_reviews.text: After using a regular brush on our German Shepherds, we revved this one up and got a surprising amount more of the undercoat out. I had balked at buying one before, due to the price that is charged at fairs and dog shows, but with the price being more attractive, ordered one here and it not only does a superb job, but the dogs get all excited to be combed out when they see us grab it from the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Reid

customer_reviews.title: but this rake does a great job digging down to help get the loose hair ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepherd that NEVER stops shedding, but this rake does a great job digging down to help get the loose hair out. The tips are rounded, so it is not uncomfortable to her (she is very sensitive to brushes if they are too harsh). Works great to use this first and then the FURminator! I don't do nearly as much sweeping on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: hrscrzgrl

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great for my Great Pyrenees foster dog! Really gets the fur out and even gets minor matts out rather easily!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome on thick coats
customer_reviews.text: This thing works amazing on my Labrador. He has a thick coat and it takes a lot of the undercoat out at a time. He also seems more relaxed when being brushed with this than the regular furminator. I got this for my parents husky and they say it’s working well for their dog too. It seems to work best for dogs with thick coats. I tried it on my thinner coated lab and it doesn’t get very much so he gets the regular furminator.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: It got so much excess hair out of my dog's fur. She is part husky and has a very thick undercoat. This worked so well with very little effort. The hair comes off the bristles easily. Some of the prongs seemed a little loose but that might be part of the design, I'm not sure. They wiggle a little but don't seem like they will come out.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Smith

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Huskies/GSDs etc.
customer_reviews.text: I have a lab/husky mix that sheds ALL THE TIME! I used the original Furminator for long hair for years and it worked but then read some interesting information on a husky coat and the rake was recommended to me. For the price, I instantly purchase and the moment I got it in the mail I tested it out. First and foremost, the original hurt my dog a little so she hated it but this one was much better and after a few strokes she realized it wasn't the same brush. Secondly, it got a ton of hair out AND it wasn't nearly as messy at the original. All in all I am extremely happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for fluffy dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My Samoyed has been shedding like crazy and I couldn't figure out how to her her falling undercoat out. This did the trick. I got a ton of loose fur removed in 15 minutes! Highly recommend this for grooming double-coated dogs.
customer_reviews.author: beta andaluz

customer_reviews.title: This rake does a great job of getting into his undercoat and pulling out ...
customer_reviews.text: This really does the trick. I have a German Shepherd and so shedding is a real issue. This rake does a great job of getting into his undercoat and pulling out the loose hair. My only complaint was on the description page, it showed which product to buy for different breeds. I almost didn't buy the product because Shepherds, Huskies, etc. Any breed with an undercoat was not shown. I was concerned that the company was shying away from breeds with undercoats because the rake didn't work that well on them. However I really needed something and had used rakes similar to this, so I took a chance. I am glad I did, because it really does work well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rake to remove excess hair.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Golden Retriever. She sheds out her undercoat a couple times a year. This rake helps remove her undercoat with ease. It helps with her shedding around the house. It seems heavy duty and durable. I recommend this if you need to comb out your dog. I’ve also used it on my goats to comb out their winter coats.
customer_reviews.author: HT

customer_reviews.title: Not for sheepdogs
customer_reviews.text: Not for long-hair dogs. Used on my sheepdog who has 1.5inch long hair at the momen. The brush started breaking apart after 10 minutes of combing. It is a great brush through and I think it’s perfect for dogs with shorter hair.
customer_reviews.author: Chantelle W.

customer_reviews.title: A really nice tool
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4-month old Pomeranian, and bought a whole bunch of grooming tools to use on his long, fluffy coat. (The others being,, and a few miscellaneous pin brushes among other things) This is by FAR the tool I used most often. Its really great for brushing out mats. Its also very sturdy. I initially bought this based off the good reviews on Amazon, and I am really glad that I did. I would purchase it again if it somehow broke. (not likely; its quite tough)
customer_reviews.author: android

customer_reviews.title: My dog who hates brushes now loves to be brushed
customer_reviews.text: OMG this works! My dog hates getting brushed. She sheds so much that we had to try to brush her every day. It was a real struggle and at 70lbs, she was not easy to wrangle. But this? She LOVES it. She sits still and willingly rolls over so we can brush her tummy. I was skeptical when I first read reviews but I thought what could it hurt? Seriously amazing
customer_reviews.author: K. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted it to be; falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Initially this product worked fine, it took out a good amount of hair from my Pomeranian-Sheltie mix. That lasted for about a month of 2x weekly use before the prongs started coming loose and have actually now started falling out. If you want something long lasting, I’d probably go another route. It also seemed to agitate my dog more than her other brushes even using more gentle strokes & ensuring it was not touching her skin, although the prongs aren’t “sharp”. I really wanted it to work based on other reviews but it fell short in a lot of ways.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work well
customer_reviews.text: This really doesn't work very well on any type of coat. I've tried it on huskies, shepherds, goldens, labs, doodles, etc. The only part of the dog it gets some hair out is the tail. Otherwise I am wasting my time with it. Get a better rake.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Grooming Tool You Can Buy
customer_reviews.text: If you can only have one tool to remove hair from your Lab, then this is it. It is the best hair removing rake, or tool, that you will ever own. When used in conjunction with the Furminator Short Hair desheding brush, it becomes and unbeatable combination. I have a chocolate Lab that is the original fur shedder and this does the trick on her. As a bonus, this is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: OldHermit

customer_reviews.title: Great Rake for Modest Price
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the very long and thick portions of my Siberian husky’s coat, like her tail and back end. Surprising affordable (I want to say I paid around $7-8 for this one) compared to the other style Furminator that I paid $40 for (but worlds great on her shorter fur/ main coat.) Recommend for long fur, especially when very thick.
customer_reviews.author: LanieCakes

customer_reviews.title: GET IT!
customer_reviews.text: Every golden retriever owners saving grace!! This has helped immensely during my boys shedding of his undercoat. Pulls it out quickly and the most I’ve ever gotten out by brushing myself. So glad I found this!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Jo white

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!
customer_reviews.text: I've had many Labs over decades, and this is the best tool for removing the undercoat without scraping or hurting. You can even use it lightly over their legs and belly. Truly helps limit the shedding in my hairy house. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Kristen L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this rake, I have a German Shepherd that has medium length hair and she is so hard to brush her undercoat, that is one of the best brushes I’ve found, I use this then the small tooth furminator and it’s amazing
customer_reviews.author: Steve & Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: This rake outshines to my $30 rakes, the pins are soft tipped and gentle, the pins spin and bust through packed in undercoat so beautifully, causes less breakage than others and is worth a lot more than it costs.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for long haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our Great Pyrenees/Anatolian shepherd mix. He's a livestock guardian dog so he lives outside full time and can get alot of burrs and mats and this helps to get them out quickly and easily. And the hair is easy to remove from the brush.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly L.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this brush “rake”!!! I love how the metal bristles rotate when brushing, this brush removes more hair than ANY brush or comb that I own!!! Perfect for my cocker spaniel who has really long hair!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lifestuckinbed

customer_reviews.title: Very good rake
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rake because of all the great reviews. I have a husky that sheds copious amounts of hair and to top that off, I am severely allergic so I had to decide whether or not to get rid of him. That is when I decided to give this rake a try and I am glad that I did. It has cut his shedding down enough that with my allergy meds he has been able to stay here with his mommy! I have been using it for about a year now and it has held up well and does a very good job!
customer_reviews.author: Imafyrstarter

customer_reviews.title: I am glad to have it
customer_reviews.text: It does the trick, but hurts a little for my VERY furry Pomeranian. Not a lot of undercoat comes out, but the tangles are removed and some under hair is removed. I am glad to have it, as it has eliminated many little and big tangle problems. Also, even the fur that gets tangeled behind the ears and under the legs, with care and turning the comb the long way like with a comb.really works.If you are combing on long fur, sometimes it helps in sensative places to hold the fur you are brushing between fingers as you pull out some of the more stubborn hair. Then your's doggie won't growl! Patience is the key, be gentle. Siva
customer_reviews.author: Omana

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy instrument.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me groom my German Shepherd Dog. GSDs are notorious for shedding A LOT. He is easy to groom, it just takes a lot of time. The grooming utensil slides easily through the fur, no pulling or yanking, just easy, repetitious combing. The handle came off the rake the second time I used it. Just like that. I will not buy another item made by "Furminator"
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Wiegand

customer_reviews.title: Best brush/comb ever for long hair cats!
customer_reviews.text: This works so amazing. Well made good comfortable handling. I brushed my two Maincoon cats and thought I gained a new cat with all the hair and undercoat it brushed out! I love this. The cats are getting used to the feeling but with a few snacks they have come around to enjoying furminator time!! It has also reduced the amount of Furballs they coughing up.
customer_reviews.author: tisha steiner

customer_reviews.title: mostly good
customer_reviews.text: I like it however, the handle comes apart and I'm having to keep pushing it back on and the pins get loose. They haven't fallen out yet but that more of them keep getting loose has me concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Jas

customer_reviews.title: All the fur
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best brush I've ever used! Love this for my border collie! It gets his undercoat is easy to clean the fur out and perfect grip for my hand and doesn't effect my wrist!
customer_reviews.author: BecaLynn

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: This take detangles the dog hair of my golden retriever before I use the Furminator long hair desheddding tool. The little "teeth" are more like nubs and there rotate to keep your dog comfy. We have used this for a full year now and it is still in great shape! Our dog loves it! This is like a little "massage" for her. I recommend this because it is worth the price and also a great seller. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Tallgrl

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for long & rough hair!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dog rake I've ever bought. It works very well on my Golden/Leonberger mix. Her hair is rough and tends to grow in matted in some places, like the backs of her legs. After using a bristle brush, I used this and the mats painlessly and easily came undone.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my bid long haired dog
customer_reviews.text: First, the handle has detached, but I epoxyed it back on (otherwise I'd give 5 stars). Otherwise, this is my go-to brush for my big Berner. Plus, because I have a big long haired dog, I do put on a lot of stress on it by pulling on it quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: SuprDavE

customer_reviews.title: No customer service value
customer_reviews.text: Came in a perfect box.After opening product I found the teeth on the ends are not stable and wiggle. I tried to reach out to find out if this was normal. I did not get a reply from Amazon or the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R

customer_reviews.title: Works on my chabrador
customer_reviews.text: I have a half chow/lab with an very thick coat. This works well but the head detaches from the handle sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S.

customer_reviews.title: Super effective and priced much lower than other Dog Rakes
customer_reviews.text: Super effective and priced much lower than other Dog Rakes. I have a year old Border Collie and I brush him about 2 to 3 times a week and this Dog Rake takes out a lot of hairs. In the beginning the dog is a bit nervous around the rake, use some treats and brush his belly if he gets too nervous. Every time my dog DJ sees me with the brush he automatically goes belly up for me to brush his belly first. Super effective!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Pizarro

customer_reviews.title: Golden retriever loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. Golden retriever loves it. Cuts down on loose hair and makes hair feel so soft.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis H.

customer_reviews.title: Great rake, wider than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works great and it's really easy to pull the combed fur off. Pulls out the undercoat without bothering the topcoat, the dogs at work mostly love it, almost all of them come back for more. (Dog daycare)
customer_reviews.author: Dushlan

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for brushing out our huge 120 lb part great pyrenees.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for brushing out our huge 120 lb part great pyrenees. It helps to rake out tons of fur before it sheds off all over our house. Great quality. Serves it purpose well!
customer_reviews.author: Kat T

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: As you can see, my wolf hybrid sheds a little in the spring. This was done with her old brush. The FURminator Grooming Rake works much better, cutting the time it takes to brush Tasha, with much less discomfort for her. As an engineer, I find the design with the rotating teeth is brilliant. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works Great .....
customer_reviews.text: My husky has dual coats and of course they shed a lot. This product works better than all the other combs I have tried. It gets down to the under coat with ease. As you can see by the picture it removes fur really well..
customer_reviews.author: E. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very fluffy Australian Shepherd that hates the deshedding brush we use. This tool she doesn't mind too much but she is just getting use to it as well. The tool works great for removing her shedding undercoat that we have been trying to get to with the deshedding tool. This tool only takes two-three passes through her fur to show a difference and it has left her coat feeling very soft!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED THIS IF YOU HAVE A HUSKY!
customer_reviews.text: SO. MUCH. HAIR. COMES. OUT OF MY HUSKY! This rake is amazing. Super easy to use and works like A DAMN CHARM! The magical fibers are never-ending but this makes it much easier to manage!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: still very useful.
customer_reviews.text: This is no Furminator de-shedding tool. This is the 2nd step to the main brush. The rake takes the extra hair off that is ready to fall. I have a chocolate lab that is currently shedding and this rake helped for her not to spread hair in every single inch of my house. However, it will not take off all the dead hair. You want to make sure you get a de-shedding tool as well (regardless of brand). Regardless, still very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

product_meta.title: FURminator Grooming Rake
product_meta.description: Style:OriginalFURminator Dog Rake features FURflex head making it easier to use on body contours. Rounded pins rotate 360 degrees to remove tangles and mats with minimal tugging and skin irritation. Intended for use on pets with long coats.
feature_bullets: All-purpose tool that separates and untangles fur
Rounded pins fully rotate to eliminate skin irriation and minimize tugging
Removes mats from undercoat and breeches
Shaped lines follow pet's contour for maximum impact

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
